title: Stay in a castle, soak in a garden hot tub in Edinburgh and snuggle into a county retreat
text:
Short breaks & City breaks Stay in a castle, soak in a garden hot tub in Edinburgh and snuggle into a county retreat Stay in a castle, soak in a garden hot tub in Edinburgh and snuggle into a county retreat COSIER than a hotel, B&B’s have come a long way! Here’s 9 luxurious locations PUBLISHED: 10:25, Sat, Aug 15, 2015 | UPDATED: 10:44, Sat, Aug 15, 2015 WOLSEY LODGES Stoke Gabriel lodgings 
1. Stay in a real Cornish castle! Drive through parkland to get to stunning Pentillie Castle near Saltash in the Tamar Valley. It’s best described as a cross between a luxury B&B and a family-run boutique hotel, offering splendour and comfort, plus plenty of walks and great views. Price from £120 for two B&B, with supper from £18 each. Also, ‘3 nights for two’ autumn offers from September 14. www.wolseylodges.com 
2. Snuggle into a 16th century Devon manor farmhouse with fabulous sea views at Strete Barton House in Dartmouth. From £53 for a double room, including breakfast, with Wolsey Lodges, plus a 10 % discount for stays of seven days or longer. http://www.wolseylodges.com/B&B/England/Devon/Dartmouth/2950.htm?LodgeID=351 
3. Stay in an elegant, Grade II listed Victorian luxury B&B and discover the Peak District at Glendon House Wolsey Lodge. It’s in the heart of Matlock in Derbyshire, the perfect base for visitors to the Peak District National Park. (10 % discount on four nights or more). http://www.wolseylodges.com/B&B/England/Derbyshire/Matlock/7971.htm?LodgeID=386 WOLSEY LODGES Glangrwyney Court 
4. Soak in the hot tub at a handy B&B to explore Edinburgh. ’23 Mayfield’ is a great stop off too, if you’re heading for the Highlands! Superb breakfasts (with a strong Scottish theme!), bicycles to hire –plus a lovely garden, complete with the hot tub, to relax in. Prices from £80 per night for two http://www.wolseylodges.com/B&B/Wales/Powys/Crickhowell/6969.htm?LodgeID=373 
5. Look to the Lakes at Cook House, near Kendal is in the historic village of Levens in Cumbria overlooking Morecambe Bay. Close by and open to the visitors is the Elizabethan family home of Levens Hall with its worldwide famous topiary garden. Sizergh Castle, Holker Hall and Leighton Hall are other attractions. B&B price,£96 a night for two, dinner £30. http://www.wolseylodges.com/B&B/England/Cumbria/Kendal/8958.htm?LodgeID=140 
6. Set in four acres of inspirational gardens within 33 acres of parkland, Glangrwyney Court in Wales promises to put the ‘treat’ into ‘retreat’. It’s furnished with antiques and is close to the Brecon Beacons National Park and Waterfall Country. (from £115 for two per night B&B) http://www.wolseylodges.com/B&B/Wales/Powys/Crickhowell/6969.htm?LodgeID=373 WOLSEY LODGES Glangrwyney Court 
7. In the heart of the lovely historic Devon market town of South Molton, the gateway to Exmoor National Park, is well placed for exploring this stunning area. (from £70 for two B&B) Ashley House 
8. Hide away in a Georgian hunting lodge in Newbottle, County Durham, within easy reach of the fabulous Beamish Museum and Hadrian’s Wall. Price to stay at Hideaway at Herrington Hill is from £100 for two, B&B. www.wolseylodges.com 
9.. With views overlooking the River Dark in Devon, Stoke Gabriel Lodgings is handy for the in Devon is handy for the magical town of Totnes. It has stunning views and has been designed to take full advantage of its high position on the hill, deep in the Devon countryside. Special offers available (£100 for room for two B&B). http://www.wolseylodges.com/B&B/England/Devon/Totnes/2959.htm?LodgeID=143 Related articles
